sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: World leaders and fans of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe offer their condolences following Friday's assassination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Europe reacts to UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's announcement that he will resign his post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tributes and condolences have been pouring in from around the world after Japan's longest serving leader Shinzo Abe was fatally shot on Friday at a political rally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Residents and news media lined the streets as the hearse carrying Abe's body left his home in Tokyo on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: India and Nepal have announced one day of national mourning as a mark of respect. This man says he had contributed and could have contributed so much more to the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This would be a great loss for Japan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While this resident from Tokyo says it is unbelievable to see an attack like this in very safe Japan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It is unbelievable that someone was walking around with a gun like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The alleged gunman, who is in police custody, has admitted shooting the former prime minister and says he was harbouring a grudge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Speaking at the G20 summit in Indonesia, Joseph Bure, the EU's foreign policy chief, offered his sympathies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Well, we are all shocked.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Abe was the most long-standing minister of Japan, a good friend of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He contributed a lot to the friendship between Japan and the European Union and to the world progress and stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida to express his outrage and sadness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He also visited the Japanese ambassador and signed a condolence book before making this statement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'd like to say just a very few words about the horrific, shocking killing of my friend, Japanese Prime Minister Abe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'm keeping his wife and family in my prayers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And the United States is standing in solidarity with our ally Japan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in New York City, the UN Security Council held a minute of silence for the assassinated former leader, and for Angola's former president, José Eduardo dos Santos, who died on Friday after a prolonged illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The fall of Boris Johnson has been received in the EU with a certain satisfaction, but

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: only behind closed doors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Brussels, nobody believes that things could really change, since the British Tory party remains united on Brexit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But it's also true that relations between Brussels and London were at the lowest point, as Johnson permanently threatened to override the Northern Ireland Protocol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There are two aspects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One is his personality, that he's inconsistent, he lies, he doesn't keep agreements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So it's very hard for anybody to deal with him, including his own cabinet ministers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's not something that just Brussels has.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On the other hand, he also had a very combative approach to Brexit because he understood that keeping the Conservative Party coalition of voters together requires the tough line on Brexit and the way he interpreted that was to be as aggressive towards the EU as possible. Thank you all very much. Among the possible candidates to replace Johnson there are many that could opt for a more practical approach. But not all of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Home Secretary, Priti Patel, is probably the person most interested in confrontation and so would be the worst candidate from the EU's point of view.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The best candidate is more open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I mean, quite a few of them could actually end up with a pretty, you know, a return to normal relations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The European Commission answered with a no comment to Euronews' question on Johnson's departure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And for the Czech Republic, the country that at this moment leads the council, there is some hope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In regard of UK-EU relationship, I hope that it won't have any serious influence on current situation and I hope that UK will oblige to international law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The relations between Johnson and Brussels were always stormy, even during his time as a correspondent for the Daily Telegraph.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He was one of the great promoters of the pro-Brexit campaign and since he arrived in Downing Street his permanent questioning of the agreements only made things worse. Few will miss him in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Columns of smoke on the horizon as fighting continues in Donetsk, eastern Ukraine. Crossfire from Russian and Ukrainian artillery is causing a steady trickle of casualties on both sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Six civilians killed by Russian shelling and 21 wounded must be added to the list of military casualties, according to Ukrainian authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian forces are trying to encircle Ukrainian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Just days ago, they conquered almost the whole of the Luhansk Oblast after pounding Severodonetsk and Lysychansk with artillery fire. In Severodonetsk, civilians remain without power, water or a sewage system, while bodies decompose in hot apartment buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: system, while bodies decompose in hot apartment buildings. A France television crew has been on both fronts and witnessed the exhaustion of soldiers after four months of war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And it's not just the military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Residents on both sides say the situation is unbearable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The war rumbles on in other parts of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kyiv claims to have destroyed a Russian ammunition depot and caused multiple casualties in the occupied Herzon province. Moscow retorts that they have destroyed two Harpoon anti-ship missile systems in Odessa, the only Ukrainian Black Sea ports not in Russian hands, and that they attacked with missiles Ukrainian soldiers who planted the national flag on Snake Island after the Russian withdrawal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The former president of Angola, José Eduardo dos Santos, has died aged 79 at this clinic in Barcelona on Friday following a long illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Dos Santos was the leader of the Portuguese-speaking, oil-rich state of Angola for 38 years, until he stepped down in September 2017, making him one of Africa's longest-serving rulers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: During almost four decades as Angola's president, he fought the continent's longest civil war and used his nation's oil wealth to turn one of his children into a billionaire, while leaving his own people among the poorest on the planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Avoiding the personality cult usually favored by dictators, Dos Santos used secretive and authoritarian tactics he learned during the Soviet era to stay in power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His daughter, Isabel, who's now under investigation for her business dealings, visited him in hospital on Friday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria could be returning to the polls again the fourth time in little more than a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister-designate Asen Vasiliev was given one week to try and end the political crisis, but failed to secure enough support to form a majority in parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While 119 lawmakers have agreed to back Vasiliev, who is the co-chair of the pro-Western We Continue the Change party, he says he hopes to gather more seats in an upcoming election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Sri Lanka have imposed a curfew until further notice in the capital after thousands of students took to the streets on Saturday calling for the President and the Prime Minister to step down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But opposition leaders say the curfew is illegal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Residents are grappling with severe food, medicine, fuel and power shortages as the country's economic crisis deepens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Law enforcement fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse the crowds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The world's richest man, Elon Musk, has announced he is terminating his 43 billion euro Twitter deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Telstra CEO says the social media platform has failed to live up to its potential as a platform for free speech and has breached multiple provisions of the merger agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But Twitter isn't accepting Musk's declaration and is determined to close a transaction on the price and terms Mr. Musk agreed to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It plans to pursue legal action to enforce the sale.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Fire departments were under strain in the south of France

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: after several wildfires broke out in Lagarde and Boucheron regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least 650 hectares of land have been destroyed while Meteo France has placed the area on maximum alert.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of firefighters were dispatched to battle the flames, but winds and high temperatures are making operations difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A spokesperson for the department says the team hoped to have the blaze under control by Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At the Moussem Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilizations in Marseille, the Pharaoh Superstars exhibition brings together more than 300 pieces from the greatest European collections to highlight. Between history and legends, the posthumous notoriety of the kings and queens of ancient Egypt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While some have become true icons of popular culture, such as Cleopatra or Tugendhamen, others have been completely forgotten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A fantastic journey of 5,000 years to discover the first superstars of humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Using loans from European museums, such as the Vatican, Louvre, Hermitage, Prado and Uffizi museums, this exhibition will give viewers an unprecedented opportunity to appreciate the breadth of Renaissance artist Raphael's skill and creativity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Through some of his most celebrated paintings and drawings, the viewer is also introduced to his work in architecture, poetry and designs for sculpture, tapestry and prints.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A master to rediscover if you are in London this July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: prints. A master to rediscover if you are in London this July. The Maxi Collection's grand new exhibition, an innovative itinerary that brings together major installations by 15 international artists, includes key works from the compilation and others commissioned for the occasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The visionary gaze of the artists evokes our time full of uncertainties and challenges but also the various human and technological possibilities that will propel this generation into the future.
